result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristen L. McGeshick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Payment plan of $100 per month commencing June 1, 2016.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kristen L. McGeshick in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:27 PM. Also called 16CF22. State - not resolved - offer as of today was count #1 on 16CF22  amend to Class I felony possession or narcotis, plead to that and count #3 and remaining counts to be DRI, $300.00 fine, 3 years probation and 1 year of conditional jail on 16CF22. Cirilli - would like time today to talk to defendant regarding going forth today with15CM214. McGeshick agrees with the offer as stated and that it is not acceptable. Cirilli has gone over Frye with the defendant. Court continues bond on 16CF22 and set it for a JT. Court sets for JT on 7/14/16 at 8:30 AM. Recess to go thru plea form on CM matter. Recalled at 1:59 PM with same appearances. State - defendant would enter g/nc plea to only count with a $300 fine plus costs. McGeshick and Cirilli agree. McGeshick pleads NC to only count. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Cirilli - follow joint recommendation. McGeshick withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - $300 fine plus costs totalling $831.00 - paid at rate of $100/month commencing 6/1/16/CO, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on April 27, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Kristen L. McGeshick in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:47 PM. Also called 16CF22. State - here for ARGN in 16CF22 and STC on 15CM214. Cirilli has Information, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond, set both for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on April 6, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Kristen L. McGeshick in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:05 AM. Called 15CM214 & 16CF22. 16CF22 - State - here for PH. Cirilli provides court with a waiver of PH form. McGeshick agrees it is a waiver. Court goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Cirilli has Information, waives reading of it and would ARGN set for a different date and time. Court continues bond on both matters, sets 16CF22 for ARGN and 15CM214 for STC. Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Kristen L. McGeshick in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:16 AM. Cirilli has complaints, waives reading of them, requests PH on CF case, waives time limits, enters NG plea on CM case. Court considers time limits waived, accepts pleas on CM cases, continues bond on both cases and sets CF for PH and CM for STC.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Kristen L. McGeshick in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:46 AM. McGeshick does not have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. McGeshick understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, has Gary Cirilli on other matter. Court sets for AIA. Defendant to let attorney know of this date and time. State - bond - $500.00 signature. Court - bond - $500.00 signature bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 09:00 am.
